cont.entity_a: Tack sharp with brilliant color. Super-sharp with built-in camera stabilization for handheld use in low light. Very sharp from f/1.8, but not the fastest in focus speed. Sharp and fast, ideal for low-light photography. Sharper and better built than Canon and Nikon lenses in this focal length.
cont.entity_b: Sharpness at f/2.8. Sharp images, but soft at f/2.8 and sharper at f/4.0.

cont.entity_a: Brighter colors and crisper images compared to other Sony lenses. Colors and microcontrast are typical Zeiss.
Round bokeh. Produces stunning images with creamy bokeh at f/1.8. Outstanding bokeh.
Heavy and not ideal for walking around, but perfect for studio headshots. Heavy, performs best on a tripod.

cont.entity_b: Solid build with all metal and glass construction.

cont.entity_a: High price but worth the quality.
Not the fastest in focus speed.
cont.entity_b: Fast focus compared to 50mm L f/1.2.

cont.entity_a: Excellent for portrait work and astrophotography.
cont.entity_b: Versatile focal length equivalent to 32mm, great for both photo and video. Wide angle good for landscapes and tight spaces.
Slight barrel distortion on crop sensor, easily corrected in post.
Prone to flaring; a lens hood is recommended.
